before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"7iptv","text":"This protocol describes the amplification of the VP1 sequence, sample barcoding and library preparation. We anticipate users will have performed an RNA extraction prior to this protocol to extract Poliovirus RNA. We recommend either the Roche High Pure Viral RNA Kit (with added proteinase K), QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit or the MagMAX Viral RNA Isolation Kit for this process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d60r6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhdpe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j3i2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sina","text":"Barcoded VP1 Primers: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67cep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvnpt","text":"For high throughout sequencing in 96 well plates, we recommend the purchase and assembly of a 96-well primer plate with 10 µM of barcoded Y7 primer and 10 µM of barcoded Q8 primer in each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"565s9","text":"Each well contains Q8 and Y7 primers with the same unique barcode e.g A1 = Y7 with barcode 1 and Q8 with barcode 1, A2 = Y7 with barcode 2 and Q8 with barcode 2, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn8dq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcjg0","text":"The full set of 96 barcoded primer sequences are shown in Dataset_S1 of Shaw et al, 2020. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"kndc","text":"This protocol is an update from the protocol described in the paper \"Rapid and sensitive direct detection and identification of poliovirus from stool and environmental surveillance samples using nanopore sequencing\" by Shaw et al  in the Journal of Clinical Microbiology (2020), DOI: 10.1128/JCM.00920-20 and is commonly known as Direct Detection of Poliovirus by Nanopore Sequencing (DDNS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ugb9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ag92","text":"The protocol aims to amplify the VP1 region of poliovirus through a nested PCR using panEV primers followed by amplification of the VP1 sequence using the Q8/Y7 primer set. We use barcoded primers as this greatly simplifies the subsequent library preparation process. Primer sequences for the panEV primers, Q8/Y7 primers and barcoded Q8/Y7 primers are found in Dataset S1 of the publication. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b5ng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1hkn","text":"This protocol is for use with Oxford Nanopore kit14 chemistry sequencing reagents and MinION Mk1B, MinION Mk1C, or GridION sequencer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"aql3c","text":"Steps 12 onwards are based on protocols from Oxford Nanopore Technologies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: NEBNext Ultra II End Repair/dA-Tailing Module - 24 rxns

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Nested PCR First Round (PanEV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1kn8f","text":"Prepare a master mix using the reaction volumes detailed in the table below for the number of samples you have plus negative controls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"236m1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g32","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15ovk","text":"Forward primer: 5'NTR [TGGCGGAACCGACTACTTTGGGTG] (Arita et al. 2015)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pj9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81ho1","text":"Reverse Primers: Cre [TCAATACGGTGTTTGCTCTTGAACTG] (Arita et al. 2015)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66ro5","text":"                                nOPV-MM-R [TCGATACGGTGCTTGGATTTAAATTG]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbej3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7r0tl","text":"Note: The reverse primers include both a Pan-enterovirus primer, and a primer which allows amplification of nOPV2. These are mixed in equally to make a 10μM working solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":115,"length":59}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9g98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iogs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edonl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cgcfq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hg7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40c3v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["173","107"],"data":[["Reagent","1 reaction (μL)"],["2x Master mix","12.5"],["SSIII Platinum Taq mix","1"],["Reverse primers (10μM)","1"],["Nuclease free water","4.5"]],"guid":"A290EBC0513011ED9CA4634C2D106DCB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e1rtl","text":"Table1: Mastermix contents for a single PanEV rt-PCR reaction. This can be multiplied up to fit the number of reactions you will be carrying out.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","1 reaction (μL)"],["2x Master mix","12.5"],["SSIII Platinum Taq mix","1"],["Reverse primers (10μM)","1"],["Nuclease free water","4.5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Nested PCR First Round (PanEV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5kb6","text":"Vortex the mastermix for 3 seconds and spin down for 5 seconds to gather contents at the bottom of the tube. Aliquot 19μL to each PCR tube and add 5μL of sample RNA or nuclease free water for negative controls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR First Round (PanEV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2r47g","text":"Incubate at 50°C for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR First Round (PanEV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5pv9q","text":"Add 1μL of the forward primer to each reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR First Round (PanEV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"emdck","text":"Amplify using the following cycling conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cejud","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q69f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bfgao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_3":{"className":" "},"A_4":{"className":" "},"A_5":{"className":" "}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["57","130","129","163"],"data":[["Cycle","Step","Temperature (°C)","Time"],["1","Initial denaturation","94","2 minutes"],["42","Denaturation","94","15 seconds"],["","Annealing","55","30 seconds"],["","Extension","68","4 minutes 30 seconds"],["1","Final extension","68","5 minutes"],["-","Hold","10","-"]],"guid":"5E571260513311ED9CA4634C2D106DCB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"956fl","text":"Table 2: Cycling conditions for the first round PanEV PCR","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{"A_3":[1,3]},"printData":[["Cycle","Step","Temperature (°C)","Time"],["1","Initial denaturation","94","2 minutes"],["42","Denaturation","94","15 seconds"],["","Annealing","55","30 seconds"],["","Extension","68","4 minutes 30 seconds"],["1","Final extension","68","5 minutes"],["-","Hold","10","-"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43n3h","text":"VP1 amplification is performed using barcoded primers as described in Dataset_S1 in Shaw et al 2020. These are in a 96-well plate layout and the forward and reverse primers can be premixed to make a 10uM working stock.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":89,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"323cu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mkqd","text":"Prepare a mastermix as described below for the number of reactions you require:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u7h4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eem3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sasu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"rr3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["186","118"],"data":[["Reagent","1 Reaction (μL)"],["DreamTaq 2x mastermix","12.5"],["Nuclease free water","8.5"]],"guid":"D7CC30F0514511ED9CA4634C2D106DCB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c03l6","text":"Table 3: Mastermix contents for second round PCR using barcoded primers.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","1 Reaction (μL)"],["DreamTaq 2x mastermix","12.5"],["Nuclease free water","8.5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bm2hf","text":"Vortex the mastermix for 3 seconds and spin down for 5 seconds to gather contents at the bottom of the tube.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3mhsl","text":"Amplify using the following cycling conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sge3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6a2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lbe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"emf8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100],"data":[["Cycle","Step","Temp (C)","Time"],["1","Initial Denaturation","95","2 minutes"],["35","Denaturation","95","30 seconds"],["","Annealing","55","30 seconds"],["","Extension","72","1 minute"],["1","Final Extension","72","10 minutes"],["-","Hold","10",""]],"guid":"1E783410514911ED9CA4634C2D106DCB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"11oa9","text":"Table 4: Cycling conditions for VP1 PCR","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{"A_3":[1,3]},"printData":[["Cycle","Step","Temp (C)","Time"],["1","Initial Denaturation","95","2 minutes"],["35","Denaturation","95","30 seconds"],["","Annealing","55","30 seconds"],["","Extension","72","1 minute"],["1","Final Extension","72","10 minutes"],["-","Hold","10",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"du40o","text":"You can check a representative set of samples on an agarose gel or Tapestation (Agilent) to confirm success of the PCR. A band is expected around 1.2kb","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b64p7","text":"Pool 2μL of each VP1 PCR product into a 1.5mL tube and concentrate with Ampure beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77vf8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm9a4","text":"Note: We have found the pooling by volume rather than quantifying and equimolar pooling works well for routine surveillance where many samples may be negative. It also cuts down the library preparation time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jjo3","text":"End-preparation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bi42","text":"Add the following reagents to the 0.2mL tube containing the cleaned DNA pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cor8j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41t7q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fdj8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["272",100],"data":[["Component","Volume (μL)"],["UltraII End-prep reaction buffer","7"],["UltraII End-prep enzyme mix","3"]],"guid":"B95A89C0515211ED9CA4634C2D106DCB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"335cv","text":"Table 5: Reaction for end-prep of your pooled library","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Component","Volume (μL)"],["UltraII End-prep reaction buffer","7"],["UltraII End-prep enzyme mix","3"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b00qr","text":"Mix gently by flicking the tube and spin down for 3 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2gas5","text":"Incubate for 5 minutes at 20C followed by 5 minutes at 65C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ru5n","text":"Spin down and thaw Ligation Adapter (LA) on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dnfa","text":"Spin down the NEB Quick T4 Ligase and place on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiq6j","text":"Thaw Ligation Buffer (LNB) at room temperature, spin down, mix by pipetting, then place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8f49","text":"Thaw Elution Buffer (EB), and Short Fragment Buffer (SFB) at room temperature, mix by vortexing then place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjb3b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnpb8","text":"Remove your flow cell from the fridge to allow it to get to room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"j7nd","text":"Prepare the following reaction mix adding reacgents to the 1.5mL tube with end-prepped DNA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kikc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4umc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8s0t9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["143",100],"data":[["Component","Volume (μL)"],["End-prepped DNA","60"],["Ligation buffer (LNB)","25"],["Quick T4 Ligase","10"],["Ligation Adapter (LA)","5"]],"guid":"09AFF6F059D011EDBBE683D379BF971D","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fqlbq","text":"Table6: Reaction mix for sequencing adapter ligation","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Component","Volume (μL)"],["End-prepped DNA","60"],["Ligation buffer (LNB)","25"],["Quick T4 Ligase","10"],["Ligation Adapter (LA)","5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7klsr","text":"Mix gently by flicking the tube then spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8f44","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dh864","text":"Quantify your adapted library using a Tapestation or Qubit Fluorometer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4bmtn","text":"Thaw the Sequencing buffer (SB), Library beads (LIB), Flow Cell Tether (FCT) and one tube of Flow Cell Flush (FCF) at room temperature then place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l7lg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmguc","text":"Mix the SQB, FCF, and FCT by vortexing, spin down, and return to ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"45v95","text":"Open the lid of the nanopore sequencing device and slide the flow cell's priming port cover clockwise so that the priming port is visible. After opening the priming port, check for any bubbles under the cover. Draw back a small volume to remove any bubbles (a few µLs). Visually check that there is continuous buffer from the priming port across the sensor array.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"41jih","text":"To create the priming mix, add 30μL of FCT and 5uL of BSA (50mg/ml) to the tube of FCF then mix by pipetting to create the priming mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lghd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75tv8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3sjm2","text":"Using a P1000 pipette, slowly load 800μL of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tuc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ob7","text":"Leave a small amount of liquid in the end of the pipette tip to ensure you do not introduce air into the flowcell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ellbp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emc1m","text":"Leave for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"532v2","text":"Mix the contents of the LIB tube by pipetting just before adding to the following library mix in a 1.5ml tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1klb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi343","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu27h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2l4om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume (μL)"],["DNA library","12"],["Sequencing buffer (SB)","37.5"],["Library beads (LIB)","25.5"]],"guid":"EE5E131059EC11EDBBE683D379BF971D","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume (μL)"],["DNA library","12"],["Sequencing buffer (SB)","37.5"],["Library beads (LIB)","25.5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"79lll","text":"Complete the flowcell priming by opening the SpotOn port cover and carefully loading 200μL of the priming mix into the priming port. As before, leave a small amount of liquid in the bottom of the tip to avoid the introduction of air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":119,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5bla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q99v","text":"When adding the priming mix, you may see a small amount of liquid come up through the SpotOn port. If you do, pause and allow the liquid to flow back into the flowcell before continuing putting through the priming mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"440q8","text":"Mix the prepared library mix gently by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7qbt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h40a","text":"Add the library mix to the flowcell via the SpotOn port in a dropwise fashion, allowing each drop to flow into the flowcell before adding the next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aj0d4","text":"Replace the SpotOn port cover and close the priming port, then replace the lid of your sequencing device.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and Loading of the MinION Flowcell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"olg1","text":"Open the ONT MinKNOW software and follow the steps to set up and start your sequencing run. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r9dt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7p1q4","text":"In the Start section, select start run and follow the prompts to select the kit used, set the run time, and set basecalling and demultiplexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f8ddi","text":"Aliquot 21μL for each well of a 96-well PCR plate and add 2μL of 10uM barcoded primers (ensuring a different barcode is used for each sample) and 2μL of first round PCR product or nuclease free water for negative controls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51uks","text":"Carry out an AMPure bead purification using 40μL of resuspended AMPure XP beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o4r4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ts54","text":"Note: This clean-up is different to previous as it uses the ONT Short Fragment Buffer (SFB) and Elution buffer (EB) instead of 80% ethanol and water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a32v3","text":"Vortex the Ampure beads until all the beads are well mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"emesb","text":"Add 40μL of resuspended beads to the 1.5mL tube and mix by flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hgr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8742u","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1kt78","text":"Spin down the tube for 3 seconds then place on a magnetic rack until all the beads have formed a pellet and the solution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"63a3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"astlt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5l3kl","text":"Pipette off the solution, avoiding disturbing the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5in65","text":"Add 250μL of Short Fragment Buffer (SFB). Remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the beads in the SFB by flicking the tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f0et","text":"Spin down for 3 seconds then return the tube to the magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0dh7","text":"Allow the beads to pellet, then remove and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eps2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehpqj","text":"Repeat. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6d8n","text":"Spin down the tube for 2 seconds, place back on the magnet, then remove any remaining SFB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm1qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5fkq","text":"Allow the pellet to air dry for 1minute or until dry but not cracked ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ich9","text":"Take the tube off the magnet and add 15μL of Elution buffer (EB). Pipette to resuspend the beads and incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2qvaf","text":"Spin down the tube for 3 seconds then place back on the magnet, allowing the beads to pellet completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8sei","text":"Remove the eluted DNA and transfer to a clean 1.5ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51uks","text":"Transfer to a 1.5mL tube and perform an AMPure bead clean.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a32v3","text":"Vortex the Ampure beads until all the beads are well mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"emesb","text":"Add 60μl of resuspended beads to the tube and flick the tube to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hgr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8742u","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1kt78","text":"Spin down the tube for 3 seconds then place on a magnetic rack until all the beads have formed a pellet and the solution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"63a3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"astlt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5l3kl","text":"Pipette off the solution, avoiding disturbing the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5in65","text":"Add 200μL of 80% Ethanol to the tube, leave for 30seconds, then remove and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eps2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehpqj","text":"Repeat. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6d8n","text":"Spin down the tube for 2 seconds, place back on the magnet, then remove any remaining Ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm1qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5fkq","text":"Allow the pellet to air dry for 1minute or until dry but not cracking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ich9","text":"Take the tube off the magnet and add 61μL of nuclease free water. Flick the tube to resuspend the beads and incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2qvaf","text":"Spin down the tube for 3 seconds then place back on the magnet, allowing the beads to pellet completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8sei","text":"Remove 60μL of the eluted DNA and add to a clean 1.5mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"au7hf","text":"Add a volume of Ampure beads equal to the volume of the pooled VP1 products and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79agl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efba7","text":"e.g. 50 samples, 2ul each pooled = 100ul pool, so add 100ul Ampure beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1kt78","text":"Spin down the tube for 3 seconds then place on a magnetic rack until all the beads have formed a pellet and the solution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"63a3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"astlt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5l3kl","text":"Pipette off the solution, avoiding disturbing the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5in65","text":"Add 200μL of 80% Ethanol to the tube, leave for 30seconds, then remove and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eps2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ehpqj","text":"Repeat. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6d8n","text":"Spin down the tube for 2 seconds, place back on the magnet, then remove any remaining Ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cm1qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5fkq","text":"Allow the pellet to air dry for 1minute or until dry but not cracking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ich9","text":"Take the tube off the magnet and add 51μL of nuclease free water. Flick the tube to resuspend the beads and incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2qvaf","text":"Spin down the tube for 3 seconds then place back on the magnet, allowing the beads to pellet completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8sei","text":"Remove 50μL of the eluted DNA and add to a clean 0.2mL PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"94ee","text":"During this time, you can run your flow cell check","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nh8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h417","text":"Plug in your sequencing device, open the lid and insert your flowcell. In the MinKNOW software, navigate to the start panel then select flowcell check, then start. This will tell you how many pores are available for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for ONT MinION: Pooling, End-prep, and Adapter ligation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mm54","text":"Transfer 20fmol (16ng) of your library into a 0.2mL PCR tube and make up to 12uL using Elution Buffer, then place on ice until ready for loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f8oj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0gar","text":"If you need to dilute the library for easier pipetting, you can dilute it in Elution Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: DDNS protocol v2
